title: Belief Systems Project
descriptions:
Abstract:

The Belief Systems Project, titled "Understanding Democratic Politics through Network Analyses of Interconnected Attitudes and Values," aims to advance the conceptualization and analysis of belief systems, a critical component of democratic politics. Current approaches to belief systems often fail to capture the interrelationships between attitudes and values, leading to a flawed understanding of political decision-making and extremism. This project proposes a novel approach by conceptualizing belief systems as networks of interconnected attitudes and values, utilizing network analyses to map their structure, central concepts, and clustering. The research will advance knowledge by mapping the structure of political belief systems over time, both between and within individuals, through diverse data sources including survey data, longitudinal panel studies, and experiments. The project will also model within-person belief system variations and test changes due to external and internal pressures. By employing a multi-faceted analytical approach, this project will provide a foundational understanding of belief systems that can inform policy and enhance theoretical frameworks in political science.
